title: Calories in Lobster Tail
meta_description: Discover calories in lobster tail, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown per 100g, and serving tips for this low-cal seafood.
assumptions: Medium lobster tail with ~100g edible meat, cooked (boiled or steamed), shell removed, no added butter, oil, or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by lobster species, size, cooking method, freshness, and added ingredients. Check sources or labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One medium cooked lobster tail (~100g meat) provides ~77 kcal and ~16.5 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Dipped in 1 tbsp melted butter per tail
Grilled with 1 tsp olive oil per 100g

faqs.q: How many calories in one lobster tail?
faqs.a: About 77 kcal for a medium cooked lobster tail with 100g edible meat.

faqs.q: Is lobster tail high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, ~16.5 g protein per 100g, making it a lean seafood option.
No carbs, fiber, or sugarsâ€”it's nearly all protein with minimal fat.

faqs.q: Why is sodium high in lobster tail?
faqs.a: Natural sodium content is ~486 mg per 100g; added salt increases it further.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect calories in lobster tail?
faqs.a: Boiling/steaming keeps it low-cal; frying or butter adds 100+ kcal per serving.
